derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent.: probably based on Old English drēosan 'to fall', of Germanic origin; probably related to dreary

entry.def: Drizzle is light rain falling in fine drops.

example.ex: The drizzle had now stopped and the sun was breaking through.
example.tran: 毛毛雨现在已经停了,太阳正破云而出。

entry.def: If it is drizzling, it is raining very lightly.

example.ex: Clouds had come down and it was starting to drizzle...
example.tran: 云层压低,开始飘起了毛毛雨。

example.ex: I walked home in the drizzling rain.
example.tran: 我冒着毛毛雨走回了家。

entry.def: If you drizzle a liquid over food or drizzle food with a liquid, you pour a small quantity of the liquid all over the food.

example.ex: Drizzle the remaining dressing over the duck and salad...
example.tran: 将剩下的调料淋在鸭肉和色拉上。

example.ex: Drizzle them with warmed extra virgin olive oil.
example.tran: 将加热过的特级初榨橄榄油淋在上面。

means.word_mean: 1. very light rain; stronger than mist but less than a shower

sentences.sentence: "When it drizzles in summer, hiking can be pleasant"

jushi.english: We haven't had any rain yet this year not even a light drizzle.
jushi.chinese: 我们这儿今年一场雨都没下,甚至连一点毛毛雨都没下。
